contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox album | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Six and Six | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Jandek]] | Cover = Six and six.jpg | Released = 1981 | Recorded = Unknown | Genre = [[Folk music]]/[[Outsider Music]] | Length = 44:26 | Label = [[Corwood Industries]] | Producer = [[Jandek]] | Last album = ''[[Ready for the House]]''<br/>(1978) | This album = ''Six and Six''<br/>(1981) | Next album = ''[[Later On]]''<br/>(1981) }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|3|5}} [{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r554967|pure_url=yes}} link] |rev2=''Op Magazine'', issue M |rev2Score=favorable<ref>[http://tisue.net/jandek/discog.html#0740 ''Op Magazine'', issue M]</ref> |rev3=''[[Forced Exposure]]''|rev3Score=not rated [http://tisue.net/jandek/discog.html#0740 link] |}} '''''Six and Six''''' is the second album by reclusive Houston musician [[Jandek]], and the first to be released under the Jandek name (the debut, ''[[Ready for the House]]'', was credited to "The Units" on first pressing). It was released in 1981, by [[Corwood Industries]] (#0740). There have been two CD reissues so far, each adding more silence between the tracks. This album appeared three years after ''Ready for the House'', which remains the longest interval between Jandek albums so far. It is composed mainly of slow songs, most of which deal with topics like regret and hopelessness. The music is stark and slow, with a flattened-out dissonant blues sound. The cover image, reminiscent of the famous photo of [[Robert Johnson (musician)|Robert Johnson]], is a photo of Jandek himself. It is one of the best known images of him. ==Track listing== #"Feathered Drums" – 3:34 #"Point Judith" – 4:16 #"I Knew You Would Leave" – 10:14 #"Can I See Your Clock" – 3:00 #"Wild Strawberries" – 6:02 #"Forgive Me" – 4:05 #"Hilltop Serenade" – 5:31 #"You're the Best One" – 3:06 #"Delinquent Words" – 3:58 == References == {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://tisue.net/jandek/discog.html#0740 Seth Tisue's ''Six and Six'' review] [[Category:Jandek albums]] [[Category:Corwood Industries albums]] [[Category:1981 albums]]
